name: monkey-of-death
text: I really like this series and I don't know why because I have no strong feelings about Oasis in any way.

name: thereminhero
text: Are you sure?

name: corm
text: WHY FIND OUT

name: lastlarf
text: A comment left by lastlarf was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, robobogle, 7th_shot, Catachresis, tttt2, rascaldom, Wulvaine)

name: catachresis
text: A comment left by catachresis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, chochacho, GeyserShitdick, equinn2006, Koremora, mistlethrush, madrin, suprememongoose, alejandroadam, lastlarf, slalvation)

name: lastlarf
text: Hmm. I remember around the time this strip was posted the word was a common slang term for "homosexual" around here. It still is in use but often only ironically now.

name: blarghamagarky
text: people in America say batty

name: achilleselbow
text: You're mistaken. You're thinking "batty" with the "a" pronounced like "apple", meaning crazy or cooky. They're saying it with the "a" pronounced like "jar", which is indeed a slang term for gay people (though I think it's outdated now). Ali G made reference to it a couple of times.

name: rowboat
text: Like "batty boy?"

name: andyfaewatford
text: Eh? No-one from Manchester will ever, EVER, pronounce the letter 'a' as it it is pronounced in 'jar', even in the word 'jar'.

name: cracklewater
text:
...kinda. Both forms of batty are pronounced the same way, with a short 'a', to rhyme with 'natty'.

It's just that a real or fake Jamaican accent will extend the 'a' sound, to almost rhyme with 'nutty' (which is how 'natty' is pronounced in the same accent).

Also, it's likely that the term comes from 'botty', which means that the 'a' spelling is just a misinterpretation of the Jamaican 'o' sound.

Fascinating!

name: presrvdkillick
text: Batty isn't exactly hard to master

name: cracklewater
text:
But 'knackers' is misused. Yer knackers are yer bollocks, not yer cock, nor indeed the external male genitalia as a whole.

Circumcised knackers would be significantly more pitiful than the regular article.

name: mr_pete
text: Man, it is not a good thing to be disliked by a sharp-witted man.

name: catachresis
text: A comment left by catachresis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, silver_lake, jstegall, mikeronomicon, erributtz, chochacho, GeyserShitdick, nipsy43, mistlethrush, suprememongoose, nutmeg, alejandroadam, slalvation)

name: alejandroadam
text: you are so full of anger. let it go. this is funny. who give a fuck if it's the most meaningful and accurate send up of something brittish.

name: catachresis
text: A comment left by catachresis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by madnes, SSDDR, shrewbie, GeyserShitdick, nipsy43, woof, alejandroadam)

text: A comment left by nurdbot was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ButterMoths, shrewbie, Cracklewater, Tangram, Footbullet)

name: rotating-dog
text: Jarvis Cocker was not in Blur. Jarvis Cocker was in Pulp. You are thinking of Damon Albarn. sheesh

name: madnes
text: It is easy to mistake them because unlike the Gallaghers, they are seldom involved in public acts of violence.

name: rotating-dog
text: This is true. Even if Pulp littered I'm sure they'd feel guilty, and write a song about it.

name: andyfaewatford
text:
(To the tune of 'Help the Aged')
Recycle Paper
Don't just put it in the bin
Recycle cans if they are steel or tin

I actually could go on. But I won't.

name: catgrl131
text: No, please do!

name: hawaiian_robot
text: Yes, I'd like to hear more, too.

name: a_dude
text: A comment left by a_dude was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by turbo_ninja, DickLaurent, shirt145)

name: rotating-dog
text: Well, Britpop did help to stop grunge imploding into self parody like 80s metal.

name: zeroasalimit
text: Not really, you got all this "Post-Grunge" crap nowadays like Creed, Nickleback and Alanis Morisette. Ugh. :S

name: rotating-dog
text: I stand corrected.

name: zeroasalimit
text: I wish I hadn't brought it up. It would be bliss to ignore such stuff. :(

name: alejandroadam
text: I agree. 'post-grunge' is lame on lame. Creed is up there with White Snake and Nelson.

name: rowboat
text: A comment left by rowboat was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by mikeronomicon, shirt145, SotiCoto)

name: tangram
text: Indeed, sir.  The cover of One Scott Stapp's solo album is very easily the best and most hilarious unintentional self-parody I've yet seen.  "The ROCK pose," and all that. In short, "Man, FUCK Creed."

name: gilgameshrex
text: even jesus hates creed.

name: rowboat
text: Especially Jesus! Can you imagine how much more you'd hate Creed if they were dedicating all of their songs specifically to you? I would smite them. Where it counts.

name: echidnaboy
text: I saw Creed live once (they were the first band on the bill at a festival) and he did that pose almost the entire time (the rest of the time he had one foot on the monitor, both hands grasping the mic, stance otherwise unchanged). To be fair, his ridiculous posturing and vocal style work a lot better on stage in front of thousands of baying idiots than blaring through a musically-illiterate roommate's door.

name: _cheesekayke
text: Yes but that does not take away real grunge's dignity. Just any poor sod who might want to make grunge-ish music after the year 1995.

name: bookofsand
text: Lyle is an entrepreneur .

name: professorhazard
text: Is Lyle voiced by Adam Carolla? It is unclear.

name: mangtastic
text: Oh man.  Now I will forever hear Adam's voice while reading Lyle's dialog.  Curses!

name: howl
text: Too self-righteous.

name: centipede_damascus
text: I never would have thought Lyle was clever enough to pull something like this off.

name: senseihollywood
text: yeah, this more of Ray's territory...

name: connellingus
text: Doing something like this takes just the right balance of desperation for money and unabashed deviance.

name: stuart
text: Yes, this is really the sort of thing Ray would only buy .

name: honesttom
text: You need Lyle to actually carry out the exploitation. Ray wouldn't do it, he'd probably just get bored and abandon them by the roadside.

name: minortough
text: It may be more Ray's style, but I'm not sure he would get behind such exploitation of good fortune. He seems to be the type to try and get rich off of someone else's success, not misfortune.

name: dueledge
text: Jack the Ripper actually means stripper in cockney rhyming slang apparently, not that I'm complaining, the Northern accents are still brilliant (even though thinking about it cockney is from London and not up north)

name: setzkin
text: Wasn't there an early strip that involved a prediction of Phillipe showering with a band?...

name: setzkin
text: Oops, it was a later strip; Attempting to BBcode it

name: gussiejives
text: Lyle could make a killing out of Liam/Noel boxing matches.

name: comrade_tom
text: This series of strips made it hard for me to listen to Oasis.

name: tekende
text: You mean Oasis doesn't make it hard for you to listen to Oasis?

name: jhunter
text:
I just want to advise people who feel like listening to Oasis to not do so.
Listen to Pulp instead. Or maybe just Jarvis Cocker solo.

Last night I had a little altercation
they wobbled menacingly
beneath the yellow street-light it became a situation
well, they wanted my brand new phone
with all the pictures of the kids and wife
a struggle ensued, and then
fat children took my life

name: mikeronomicon
text: Ok, I take back my previous post on the last strip. This is way better than disemboweling the band. Onstad, I salute you!
